cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north, then turning north-northwest across Haiti and Cuba, through the Bahamas, and curving toward the southeast U.S. coastline with South Carolina in the 4- to 5-day cone
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast in the vicinity of Charleston

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida through South Carolina, including Charleston area, lies inside the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) are 37 % probable overall, with a 14 % chance of 50 kt winds and up to a 6 % chance of hurricane-force gusts as the center nears Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft above ground level possible in Charleston Harbor and adjacent coast if the storm passes just offshore at hurricane strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could bring 4–10 inches with localized higher totals, producing flash-flood risk in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible quick-spin tornadoes in outer rainbands, and prolonged high water levels in estuaries could disrupt port operations.
